official-title.#text:
To ensure and foster continued safety and quality of care
		  and a competitive marketplace by exempting independent pharmacies from the
		  antitrust laws in their negotiations with health plans and health insurance
		  insurers.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the
			 following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Preserving Our Hometown Independent
			 Pharmacies Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Application of
			 the antitrust laws to independent pharmacies negotiating with health
			 plans

text.#text:
Any independent
			 pharmacies who are engaged in negotiations with a health plan regarding the
			 terms of any contract under which the pharmacies provide health care items or
			 services for which benefits are provided under such plan shall, only in
			 connection with such negotiations, be treated under the antitrust laws as an
			 employee engaged in concerted activities and shall not be regarded as having
			 the status of an employer, independent contractor, managerial employee, or
			 supervisor.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall not be the subject under the antitrust laws of criminal
			 sanctions nor of any civil damages, fees, or penalties beyond actual damages
			 incurred.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Preserving Our Hometown Independent Pharmacies Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , or as affecting the status of any group of persons under that Act.

Nothing in this section shall be
			 construed as changing or amending any provision of the

header.#text:
No change in
			 National Labor Relations Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall apply to
			 conduct occurring beginning on the date of the enactment of this Act.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Preserving Our Hometown Independent Pharmacies Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a

text.#text: The exemption provided in

Nothing in this section shall exempt from the
			 application of the antitrust laws any agreement or otherwise unlawful
			 conspiracy that—

would have the effect of boycotting any
			 independent pharmacy or group of independent pharmacies, or would exclude,
			 limit the participation or reimbursement of, or otherwise limit the scope of
			 services to be provided by, any independent pharmacy or group of independent
			 pharmacies with respect to the performance of services that are within the
			 scope of practice as defined or permitted by relevant law or regulation;

allocates a market among
			 competitors;

unlawfully ties
			 the sale or purchase of one product or service to the sale or purchase of
			 another product or service; or

monopolizes or
			 attempts to monopolize a market.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
) if the number of
			 pharmacy licenses of such pharmacies within such group in such region exceeds
			 25 percent of the total number of pharmacy licenses issued to all retail
			 pharmacies (including both independent and other pharmacies) in such
			 region.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Preserving Our Hometown Independent Pharmacies Act of 2013/s:2/ss:j/p:4
